intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. sumatrana, commonly known as Sumatran flatleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its fibrous stems have been historically utilized for making textiles and paper.
